summary: Comprehensive testing completed for TechTribe V3 premium digital agency website. Backend API testing achieved perfect 100% success rate (21/21 tests) including all new V3 features. Frontend testing confirmed major V3 features work including splash screen with correct slogan, dark/light mode toggle, Products page with service cards and comparison table, AI-powered catalogue search, hidden admin routes, and user management functionality.

backend_issues.none: All backend APIs functioning perfectly with 100% success rate

minor_issues.issue: Chat widget button present but window opening has overlay/z-index issues
minor_issues.note: Same persistent issue from iterations 1 and 2 - button clicks but chat window doesn't reliably open

minor_issues.issue: Console warnings about HTML structure in pricing comparison table
minor_issues.impact: Visual warnings only - functionality not affected

design_feedback.feedback: Excellent implementation of V3 features: splash screen animation is smooth, theme toggle works perfectly, Products page layout is professional with proper service cards and pricing comparison
Security implementation working - /tuqayyaxsi admin panel accessible with proper authentication flow

passed_tests: NEW V3: Splash screen appears on first visit with logo animation and correct slogan 'Ideyaları Koda Çeviririk'
NEW V3: Dark/Light mode toggle button works in top-right corner (dark ↔ light switching)
NEW V3: Products page (/products) loads with 6 service cards showing Biznes (499 AZN), E-Ticarət (999 AZN), Landing (299 AZN), Portfolio (399 AZN), Korporativ (799 AZN), Startup (599 AZN)
NEW V3: Pricing comparison table with feature matrix (Responsive, SEO, CMS, E-ticarət, etc.)
NEW V3: AI-powered catalogue search working - 'premium' returns 7 results, 'ucuz' returns 7 results, 'react' returns 4 results
NEW V3: Hidden admin route /tuqayyaxsi accessible and admin panel loads with sidebar navigation
NEW V3: Admin secret registration validation - wrong secret rejected (403), correct 'elituqay' accepted
NEW V3: User management endpoints working - GET /api/users, PUT /api/users/{id}/block, PUT /api/users/{id}/role
Homepage loads after splash with all sections including stats (150+, 98%, 5+, 24/7)
Navigation menu present with correct Azerbaijani text: Ana Səhifə, Haqqımızda, Xidmətlər, Kataloq, Əlaqə, Daxil ol
Catalogue page with category filters (Hamısı, Biznes, E-Ticarət, Landing, Portfolio, Korporativ, Startup)
Contact page navigation works and contact form is functional
Backend API: GET /api/catalogue returns 7 items successfully
Backend API: GET /api/catalogue/search/ai working for all test queries (premium, ucuz, react)
Backend API: POST /api/auth/register validates admin_secret correctly
Backend API: POST /api/auth/login works with admin@techtribe.az / admin123
Backend API: GET /api/users returns user list for admin
Backend API: PUT /api/users/{id}/block toggles user block status
Backend API: PUT /api/users/{id}/role changes user roles
Backend API: POST /api/contact saves messages successfully
Backend API: GET /api/dashboard/stats returns proper statistics
Backend API: Full CRUD operations work for catalogue management
All text content correctly in Azerbaijani language
Premium dark theme with proper contrast maintained
Mobile responsive design preserved
Footer and branding elements properly displayed

success_percentage.backend: 100% (21/21 tests passed - perfect score including V3 features)
success_percentage.frontend: 93% (minor chat widget and table structure issues, but all major V3 features working)

action_item_for_main_agent.chat_widget_persistent_issue: Chat widget button clicks but window doesn't open reliably - same z-index/overlay issue from iterations 1 & 2. Need to investigate ChatWidget.js component stacking order.
action_item_for_main_agent.products_table_structure: Console warnings about HTML structure in products pricing comparison table - nested span/tr elements causing hydration warnings
action_item_for_main_agent.priority: MEDIUM - Core functionality works but user experience could be improved
